titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 244: Il Genesi

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 244: Il Genesi are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (Zacour-Hirsch) and from description pasted inside upper cover; see also f. 1r, 2r and 3r.
Attribution from Zacour-Hirsch and from description pasted inside upper cover.
Some oxidation of ink in places, occasionally making the text hard to read.
Binding pulling loose in places; spine breaking between ff. 36-37. Cover splitting, cracking and peeling at spine and at edges.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Poetical paraphrase of Genesis by Pietro Aretino.

supportDesc.extent: 109 leaves : 211 x 136 (154 x 86) mm. bound to 215 x 137 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 109; [1-109]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 21 long lines; ruled in ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a 16th-century humanistic script by a single hand, allegedly in the autograph of Pietro Aretino (seller's description, inside upper cover).

origin.p: Written in Italy in the first half of the 16th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Vicentius Marini (bookplate, inside upper cover).
Sold by Martin Breslauer, cat. 67 (1949), no. 7.
